Class WFont

java.lang.Object
us.mn.state.dot.tms.utils.wysiwyg.WFont
All Implemented Interfaces:
SonarObject, Font
public class WFont extends Object implements Font
WFont caches glyphs for characters in a font.
Author:
John L. Stanley - SRF Consulting

  • Field Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • WFont

      public WFont(Font f)
      Construct a WFont. (Also pre-loads all WGlyphs in the font.)

  • Method Details

    • getGlyph

    • getGlyph

      public WGlyph getGlyph(char ch)
      Get glyph for char ch

    • glyphs

      public Iterator<WGlyph> glyphs(int fontNum)
      Returns an Iterator<WGlyph> for all WGlyphs in the font ordered by character number

    • getMaxCharWidth

      public int getMaxCharWidth()
      Get maximum character width in font

    • getCharSpacing

      public int getCharSpacing(Integer chsp)
      Get character spacing
      Parameters:
      chsp - Character spacing (null = use font default)

    • getTextWidth

      public int getTextWidth(Integer chsp, String str)
      Get pixel-width of a specified string. Any chars in the string that are not in the font are ignored.
      Parameters:
      chsp - Character spacing (null = use font default)
      str - string to measure

    • getCharWidth

      public int getCharWidth(char ch)
      Get pixel-width of a specified char. Any chars that are not in the font return 0.
      Parameters:
      ch - Character number

    • getIntWidth

      public int getIntWidth(Integer chsp, int i)
      Get pixel-width of a specified integer. (converted to a string).
      Parameters:
      chsp - Character spacing (null = use font default)
      i - Number to measure.

    • getIntWidth

      public int getIntWidth(Integer chsp, int imin, int imax)
      Get max pixel-width required to display any number in a range of numbers.
      Parameters:
      chsp - Character spacing (null = use font default)
      imin - Minimum number to measure
      imax - Maximum number to measure
